title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/traits.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version traits ropensci/traits) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/traits.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/traits

title: BETYdb Tutorial
code: library("traits")

title: BETYdb Tutorial
text: Get trait data Miscanthus giganteus Summarise data output data.frame Single trait
code: out <- betydb_search(query = "Switchgrass Yield") suppressPackageStartupMessages(library("dplyr")) out %>%   group_by(id) %>%   summarise(mean_result = mean(as.numeric(mean), na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(mean_result)) #> # A tibble: 449 x 2 #>       id mean_result #>    <int>       <dbl> #>  1  1666        27.4 #>  2 16845        27   #>  3  1669        26.4 #>  4 16518        26   #>  5  1663        25.4 #>  6 16742        25   #>  7  1594        24.8 #>  8  1674        22.7 #>  9  1606        22.5 #> 10  1665        22.5 #> # … with 439 more rows betydb_trait(id = 10) #> # A tibble: 1 x 13 #>      id description units notes created_at updated_at name  max   min   #>   <int> <chr>       <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr>      <chr> <chr> <chr> #> 1    10 Leaf Perce… perc… <NA>  <NA>       2011-06-0… leafN 10    0.02  #> # … with 4 more variables: standard_name <chr>, standard_units <chr>, #> #   label <chr>, type <chr>

title: BETYdb Tutorial
text: Single species, Acacia karroothorn
code: betydb_specie(id = 10) #> # A tibble: 1 x 10 #>      id spcd  genus species scientificname commonname notes created_at #>   <int> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>          <chr>      <chr> <chr>      #> 1    10 <NA>  Acac… karroo  Acacia karroo  karrootho… <NA>  <NA>       #> # … with 2 more variables: updated_at <chr>, acceptedsymbol <chr>

title: BETYdb Tutorial
text: Get citatons searching Miscanthus
code: betydb_citation(10) #> # A tibble: 1 x 13 #>      id author  year title journal   vol pg    url   pdf   created_at updated_at #>   <int> <chr>  <int> <chr> <chr>   <int> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr>      #> 1    10 Casler  2003 Cult… Crop S…    43 2226… http… http… <NA>       <NA>       #> # … with 2 more variables: doi <chr>, user_id <chr>

title: BETYdb Tutorial
text: Single site
code: betydb_site(id = 1) #> # A tibble: 1 x 8 #>   city    state country notes sitename greenhouse geometry           time_zone   #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr> <chr>    <lgl>      <chr>              <chr>       #> 1 Aliart… <NA>  GR      <NA>  Aliartos FALSE      POINT (23.17 38.3… Europe/Ath…

title: traits introduction
text: Get trait data Willow (Salix spp.) Summarise data output data.frame
code: (salix <- betydb_search("Salix Vcmax")) #> # A tibble: 14 x 36 #>    checked result_type    id citation_id site_id treatment_id sitename city  #>      <int> <chr>       <int>       <int>   <int>        <int> <chr>    <chr> #>  1       1 traits      39217         430     645         1342 ""       Saare #>  2       1 traits      39218         430     645         1343 ""       Saare #>  3       1 traits      39219         430     645         1344 ""       Saare #>  4       1 traits      39220         430     645         1345 ""       Saare #>  5       1 traits      25405          51      NA            1  <NA>    <NA>  #>  6       1 traits      39213         430     645         1342 ""       Saare #>  7       1 traits      39214         430     645         1343 ""       Saare #>  8       1 traits      39215         430     645         1344 ""       Saare #>  9       1 traits      39216         430     645         1345 ""       Saare #> 10       1 traits      39221         430     645         1342 ""       Saare #> 11       1 traits      39222         430     645         1343 ""       Saare #> 12       1 traits      39223         430     645         1344 ""       Saare #> 13       1 traits      39224         430     645         1345 ""       Saare #> 14       1 traits      37519         381     602         1220  <NA>    <NA>  #> # … with 28 more variables: lat <dbl>, lon <dbl>, scientificname <chr>, #> #   commonname <chr>, genus <chr>, species_id <int>, cultivar_id <int>, #> #   author <chr>, citation_year <int>, treatment <chr>, date <chr>, time <chr>, #> #   raw_date <chr>, month <int>, year <int>, dateloc <chr>, trait <chr>, #> #   trait_description <chr>, mean <dbl>, units <chr>, n <int>, statname <chr>, #> #   stat <dbl>, notes <chr>, access_level <int>, cultivar <chr>, entity <lgl>, #> #   method_name <lgl> # equivalent: # (out <- betydb_search("willow")) library("dplyr") salix %>%   group_by(scientificname, trait) %>%   mutate(.mean = as.numeric(mean)) %>%   summarise(mean = round(mean(.mean, na.rm = TRUE), 2),             min = round(min(.mean, na.rm = TRUE), 2),             max = round(max(.mean, na.rm = TRUE), 2),             n = length(n)) #> # A tibble: 4 x 6 #> # Groups:   scientificname [4] #>   scientificname                  trait  mean   min   max     n #>   <chr>                           <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> #> 1 Salix                           Vcmax  65    65    65       1 #> 2 Salix dasyclados                Vcmax  46.1  34.3  56.7     4 #> 3 Salix sachalinensis × miyabeana Vcmax  79.3  79.3  79.3     1 #> 4 Salix viminalis                 Vcmax  43.0  20.0  61.3     8

what: Species Trait Data from Around the Web
title: Species Trait Data from Around the Web
text: R client various sources species trait data. Docs: https://docs.ropensci.org/traits/ trait? “trait” purposes package broadly defined aspect species can described measured, physical traits (size, length, height, color), behavioral traits (running speed, etc.), even variables make niche species (e.g., habitat). Included traits associated function prefix function name: Talk us issues page (https://github.com/ropensci/traits/issues) know source traits data API, ’ll see including .

title: Species Trait Data from Around the Web
text: Stable CRAN version development version GitHub
code: install.packages("traits") remotes::install_github("ropensci/traits") library("traits") library("dplyr")

title: Species Trait Data from Around the Web
text: Scott Chamberlain Zachary Foster Ignasi Bartomeus David LeBauer David Harris Chris Black Rupert Collins

title: Species Trait Data from Around the Web
text: Please report issues bugs. License: MIT Get citation information traits R citation(package = 'traits') Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
text: Search traits BETYdb Get details single item table

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
code: betydb_record(   id,   table,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   fmt = NULL,   key = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   ... )  betydb_trait(   id,   genus = NULL,   species = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   fmt = "json",   key = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   ... )  betydb_specie(   id,   genus = NULL,   species = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   fmt = "json",   key = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   ... )  betydb_citation(   id,   genus = NULL,   species = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   fmt = "json",   key = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   ... )  betydb_site(   id,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   fmt = "json",   key = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   ... )  betydb_experiment(   id,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   fmt = "json",   key = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   ... )

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
text: id (integer) One ids species, site, variable, etc. table (character) Name database table ID associated. api_version (character) version BETY API query? One "v0" "beta". Default options("betydb_api_version") set, otherwise  "v0". betyurl (string) url target instance betydb. Default options("betydb_url") set, otherwise "https:/www.betydb.org/" fmt (character) Format return data , one json, xml, csv. json currently supported. key (character) API key. Use user/pwd combo. Save .Rprofile file options(betydb_key = "your40digitkey"). Optional user, pwd (character) user name password. Use user/pwd combo API key. Save .Rprofile file options(betydb_user = "yournamehere") options(betydb_pwd = "yourpasswordhere"). Optional progress show progress bar? default: TRUE ... Curl options passed GET. Optional genus (character) genus name. Optional species (character) specific epithet. Optional

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
text: BETYdb includes primary home page (betydb.org) focused bioenergy crops well network harmonized databases support share data among focused research programs. list publicly accessible instances BETYdb urls can queried, see https://pecan.gitbooks.io/betydb-documentation/content/distributed_betydb.html package queries plant traits, phenotypes, biomass yields, ecosystem functions. currently interface workflow provenance data support PEcAn Project (pecanproject.org) TERRA REF (terraref.org) software. API documentation: https://pecan.gitbooks.io/betydb-data-access/content/API.html API endpoints : https://www.betydb.org/api/docs package currently uses original 'v0' API default. use newer version, set api_version. Newer versions API support database inserts.

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
text: Defers use API key first since simpler, API key, can supply username password.

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
text: Singular functions like betydb_trait accept id additional parameters, return list variable outputs depending inputs. However, plural functions like betydb_traits accept query parameters, ids, always return single data.frame. betydb_search("Search terms", ...) convenience wrapper passes arguments betydb_query(table = "search", search = "Search terms", ...). See details possible arguments.

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
text: API documentation https://pecan.gitbooks.io/betydb-data-access/content/API.html https://www.betydb.org/api/docs

title: Search for traits from BETYdb — betydb
code: if (FALSE) { # General Search out <- betydb_search(query = "Switchgrass Yield") library("dplyr") out %>%  group_by(id) %>%  summarise(mean_result = mean(as.numeric(mean), na.rm = TRUE)) %>%  arrange(desc(mean_result)) # Get by ID ## Traits betydb_trait(id = 10) ## Species betydb_specie(id = 1) ## Citations betydb_citation(id = 1) ## Site information betydb_site(id = 795) }

title: Query a BETY table — betydb_query
text: Query BETY table

title: Query a BETY table — betydb_query
code: betydb_query(   ...,   table = "search",   key = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   betyurl = NULL,   user = NULL,   pwd = NULL,   progress = TRUE )  betydb_search(   query = "Maple SLA",   ...,   include_unchecked = NULL,   progress = TRUE )

title: Query a BETY table — betydb_query
text: ... (named character) Columns query, key="value" pairs. Note betydb_query passes along BETY check whether requested keys exist specified table. table (character) name database table query, "search" (default) traits yields view key (character) API key. Use user/pwd combo. Save .Rprofile file options(betydb_key = "your40digitkey"). Optional api_version (character) version BETY API query? One "v0" "beta". Default options("betydb_api_version") set, otherwise  "v0". betyurl (string) url target instance betydb. Default options("betydb_url") set, otherwise "https:/www.betydb.org/" user, pwd (character) user name password. Use user/pwd combo API key. Save .Rprofile file options(betydb_user = "yournamehere") options(betydb_pwd = "yourpasswordhere"). Optional progress show progress bar? default: TRUE query (character) string containing one words queried across columns "search" table. include_unchecked (logical) Include results quality checked? Applies tables "checked" column: "search", "traits", "yields". Default exclude unchecked values.

title: Query a BETY table — betydb_query
text: data.frame attributes containing request metadata, NULL query produced results

title: Query a BETY table — betydb_query
text: Use betydb_query retrieve records table match column filters specified '...'. filters specified, retrieves whole table. API versions support (.e. v0), filter strings beginning "~" treated regular expressions.

title: Query a BETY table — betydb_query
code: if (FALSE) { # literal vs regular expression vs anchored regular expression: betydb_query(units = "Mg", table = "variables") # NULL betydb_query(units = "Mg/ha", table = "variables") %>% select(name) %>% c() # $name # [1] "a_biomass"                  "root_live_biomass" # [3] "leaf_dead_biomass_in_Mg_ha" "SDM"  betydb_query(genus = "Miscanthus", table = "species") %>% nrow() # [1] 10 (betydb_query(genus = "~misc", table = "species", api_version = "beta")  %>% select(genus)  %>% unique() %>% c()) # $genus # [1] "Platymiscium" "Miscanthus"   "Dermiscellum"  (betydb_query(genus = "~^misc", table = "species", api_version = "beta")  %>% select(genus)  %>% unique() %>% c()) # $genus # [1] "Miscanthus" }

title: Access LEDA trait data — leda
text: parameter trait, one age_first_flowering, branching, buds_seasonality, buds_vertical_dist, canopy_height, dispersal_type, leaf_distribution, ldmc_geo, leaf_mass, leaf_size, morphology_disperal, growth_form, life_span, releasing_height, seed_longevity, seed_mass, seed_number, seed_shape, shoot_growth_form, snp, ssd, tv, clonal_growth_organs following supported much pain parse: buoyancy, seed_bank, sla_geo

title: Access LEDA trait data — leda
code: if (FALSE) { # Age of first flowering leda(trait = "age_first_flowering")  # Seed number leda("seed_number")  # Releasing height leda(trait = "releasing_height")  # Clonal growth organs leda(trait = "clonal_growth_organs")  all <- c("age_first_flowering", "branching", "buds_seasonality",   "buds_vertical_dist", "canopy_height",   "dispersal_type", "leaf_distribution", "ldmc_geo", "leaf_mass",   "leaf_size", "morphology_disperal", "growth_form", "life_span",   "releasing_height", "seed_longevity", "seed_mass",   "seed_number", "seed_shape", "shoot_growth_form",   "snp", "ssd", "tv", "clonal_growth_organs") out <- list() for (i in seq_along(all)) {   cat(all[i], sep="\n")   out[[i]] <- leda(all[i]) } sapply(out, NROW) }

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by accession number. — ncbi_byid
text: ids (character) GenBank ids search . One . Required. format (character) Return type, e.g., "fasta". NOW IGNORED. verbose (logical) TRUE (default), informative messages printed.

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by accession number. — ncbi_byid
text: data.frame form: taxon - taxonomic name (may include junk, hard parse ) taxonomy - organism lineage gene_desc - gene description organelle - mitochondrial chloroplast gi_no - GI number acc_no - accession number keyword - official DNA barcode specimen_voucher - museum/lab accession number vouchered material lat_lon - longitude/latitude specimen collection event country - country/location specimen collection event paper_title - title study journal - journal study published (published) first_author - first author study uploaded_date - date sequence uploaded GenBank length - sequence length sequence - sequence character string

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by accession number. — ncbi_byid
text: bad ids included good ones, bad ones silently dropped. ids bad get stop error message.

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by accession number. — ncbi_byid
text: Scott Chamberlain, Rupert Collins

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by accession number. — ncbi_byid
code: if (FALSE) { # A single gene ncbi_byid(ids="360040093")  # Many genes (with different accession numbers) ncbi_byid(ids=c("360040093","347448433")) }

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by taxon name and gene names. — ncbi_byname
text: taxa (character) Scientific name search . gene (character) Gene genes (vector) search . See examples. seqrange (character) Sequence range, e.g., "1:1000". range sequence lengths search . "1:1000" means search sequences 1 1000 characters length. getrelated (logical) TRUE, gets longest sequences species genus one searched . FALSE, returns nothing match found. verbose (logical) TRUE (default), informative messages printed. ... Curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by taxon name and gene names. — ncbi_byname
text: data.frame

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by taxon name and gene names. — ncbi_byname
text: Removes predicted sequences remove . Predicted sequences accession numbers "XM_" "XR_" prefixes. function retrieves one sequences species, picking longest available given gene.

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by taxon name and gene names. — ncbi_byname
text: Scott Chamberlain

title: Retrieve gene sequences from NCBI by taxon name and gene names. — ncbi_byname
code: if (FALSE) { # A single species ncbi_byname(taxa="Acipenser brevirostrum")  # Many species species <- c("Colletes similis","Halictus ligatus","Perdita californica") ncbi_byname(taxa=species, gene = c("coi", "co1"), seqrange = "1:2000") }

what: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
text: Search gene sequences available taxa NCBI.

title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
code: ncbi_searcher(   taxa = NULL,   id = NULL,   seqrange = "1:3000",   getrelated = FALSE,   fuzzy = FALSE,   limit = 500,   entrez_query = NULL,   hypothetical = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   sleep = 0L )

title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
text: taxa (character) Scientific name search . id (character) Taxonomic id search . compatible argument taxa. seqrange (character) Sequence range, e.g., "1:1000". range sequence lengths search . "1:1000" means search sequences 1 1000 characters length. getrelated (logical) TRUE, gets longest sequences species genus one searched . FALSE, returns nothing match found. fuzzy (logical) Whether fuzzy taxonomic ID search exact search. TRUE, use xXarbitraryXx[porgn:__txid<ID>], FALSE, use txid<ID>. Default: FALSE limit (numeric) Number sequences search return. Max 10,000. search 6000 records, 5000 found, course get 5000 back. entrez_query (character; length 1) Entrez-format query filter results . useful search sequences specific characteristics. format one used seach genbank. (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK3837/#EntrezHelp.Entrez_Searching_Options) hypothetical (logical; length 1) FALSE, attempt made return hypothetical predicted sequences judging accession number prefixs (XM XR). can result less limit returned even sequences available, since filtering done searching NCBI. verbose (logical) TRUE (default), informative messages printed. sleep (integer) number seconds sleep HTTP request. use running 429 Many Requests errors NCBI. default: 0 (sleep)

title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
text: data.frame results single input given. list data.frames multiple inputs given.

title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
text: NCBI rate limits requests. set API key higher rate limit. Set API key like Sys.setenv(ENTREZ_KEY="yourkey") can use ?rentrez::set_entrez_key. set verbose curl output (crul::set_verbose()) make sure api key sent requests

title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
text: Scott Chamberlain, Zachary Foster zacharyfoster1989@gmail.com

title: Search for gene sequences available for taxa from NCBI. — ncbi_searcher
code: if (FALSE) { # A single species out <- ncbi_searcher(taxa="Umbra limi", seqrange = "1:2000") # Get the same species information using a taxonomy id out <- ncbi_searcher(id = "75935", seqrange = "1:2000") # If the taxon name is unique, using the taxon name and id are equivalent all(ncbi_searcher(id = "75935") ==  ncbi_searcher(taxa="Umbra limi")) # If the taxon name is not unique, use taxon id #  "266948" is the uid for the butterfly genus, but there is also a genus #  of orchids with the #  same name nrow(ncbi_searcher(id = "266948")) ==  nrow(ncbi_searcher(taxa="Satyrium")) # get list of genes available, removing non-unique unique(out$gene_desc) # does the string 'RAG1' exist in any of the gene names out[grep("RAG1", out$gene_desc, ignore.case=TRUE),]  # A single species without records in NCBI out <- ncbi_searcher(taxa="Sequoia wellingtonia", seqrange="1:2000",   getrelated=TRUE)  # Many species, can run in parallel or not using plyr species <- c("Salvelinus alpinus","Ictalurus nebulosus","Carassius auratus") out2 <- ncbi_searcher(taxa=species, seqrange = "1:2000") lapply(out2, head) library("plyr") out2df <- ldply(out2) # make data.frame of all unique(out2df$gene_desc) # get list of genes available, removing non-unique out2df[grep("12S", out2df$gene_desc, ignore.case=TRUE), ]  # Using the getrelated and entrez_query options ncbi_searcher(taxa = "Olpidiopsidales", limit = 5, getrelated = TRUE,             entrez_query = "18S[title] AND 28S[title]")  # get refseqs one <- ncbi_searcher(taxa = "Salmonella enterica",   entrez_query="srcdb_refseq[PROP]") two <- ncbi_searcher(taxa = "Salmonella enterica") }

title: Search for traits from EOL's Traitbank — traitbank
text: list

title: Search for traits from EOL's Traitbank — traitbank
text: traitbank interface EOL Cypher query. Note previous interface EOL Traits completely replaced - thus, function completely different. longer query EOL page id, using query language database called Neo4J. See docs help. Later plan make user friendly interface get Traitbank data require knowing Neo4J query syntax

title: Search for traits from EOL's Traitbank — traitbank
text: need EOL cypher key use function. Get one signing EOL account https://eol.org/users/sign_in head https://eol.org/services/authenticate get key. Store key .Renviron file similar name "EOL_CYPHER_KEY", use key function. Alternatively, can pass key key parameter, recommend risk accidentally committing key public web.

title: Search for traits from EOL's Traitbank — traitbank

title: Caching — traits_cache
text: Manage cached traits package files hoardr

title: Caching — traits_cache
text: dafault cache directory paste0(rappdirs::user_cache_dir(), "/R/traits"), can set path using cache_path_set() cache_delete accepts 1 file name, cache_delete_all accept names, deletes files. deleting many specific files, use cache_delete lapply() type call

title: Caching — traits_cache
text: traits_cache$cache_path_get() get cache path traits_cache$cache_path_set() set cache path traits_cache$list() returns character vector full path file names traits_cache$files() returns file objects metadata traits_cache$details() returns files details traits_cache$delete() delete specific files traits_cache$delete_all() delete files, returns nothing

title: Caching — traits_cache
code: if (FALSE) { traits_cache  # list files in cache traits_cache$list()  # delete certain database files # traits_cache$delete("file path") # traits_cache$list()  # delete all files in cache # traits_cache$delete_all() # traits_cache$list()  # set a different cache path from the default }

title: traits 0.4.0
text: New package author: Chris Black (@infotroph) (#106) betydb functions now can pagination (#94) betydb functions gain progress parameter optionally suppress progress bar (#113) EOL Traitbank completely changed query interface - function longer works . now, specify query ’s rather complex, see docs help. Later can try simplify queries users (#112)

title: traits 0.4.0
text: table README different sources clarify traits (#110) (#111) fixed link Birdlife (#108)

title: traits 0.4.0
text: fix ncbi_searcher() prevent failures cases (#107) thanks @zachary-foster fix ncbi_byid(): ten new fields added output (#101) (#102) thanks @boopsboops

title: traits 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-09-22

title: traits 0.3.0
text: Four functions now defunct - involving getting data whether species native/invasive particular region. See ?traits-defunct information. Deprecated functions: eol_invasive_(), fe_native(), g_invasive(), is_native() (#72)

title: traits 0.3.0
text: Gains new function tr_ernest dataset Amniote life history data (#60) Gains new function tr_usda USDA plants database (#61) Gains new function tr_zanne dataset plant growth data (#73) BetyDB functions gain automatic paging large requests API supports , .e. v0 (#94)

title: traits 0.3.0
text: Change Coral database base URL https (#99) Now requiring readr > 1.0 (#76) Changed ncbi_*() functions give back NA types match data.frame column classes make combining easier (#96) replace xml2::xml_find_one xml2::xml_find_first throughout (#97) namespace fxn calls base pkgs, remove Imports (#98) BetyDB cleanup (#25) (#77) (#82) (#88)

title: traits 0.3.0
text: Fixed birdlife* functions needed change URL structure due changes Birdlife website (#100) Fixes traitbank() (#79) (#80) thanks @dschlaep ! ncbi_*() fxns now use https (#95)

title: traits 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-03-18

title: traits 0.2.0
text: Marked four functions deprecated - involving getting data whether species native/invasive particular region. See ?traits-deprecated information. Deprecated functions: eol_invasive_(), fe_native(), g_invasive(), is_native() (#63)

title: traits 0.2.0
text: Standardized outputs data - data.frame column names lowercase now (#47) httr::content() calls now explicitly setting encoding UTF-8, parsing text, manually parsing either JSON XML later (#65) Replaced XML xml2 XML parsing (#67)

title: traits 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2015-09-12

title: traits 0.1.2
text: ncbi_searcher() gains new parameter fuzzy toggle fuzzy taxonomic ID search exact search. (#34) (thx @mpnelsen)

title: traits 0.1.2
text: Importing functions (via importFrom) used across imports now. addition, importFrom non-base R pkgs, including methods, stats utils packages (#36) Changed trait parameter traitbank() function pageid, EOL expects page identifier, associated taxon, trait. previous parameter name misleading.
